testsuite.name: au.edu.uq.smartass.question.ArithmeticSequenceSumOfNTermsModuleTest
testsuite.system-out: \begin{align*} S_n&=\dfrac{n}{2}(2a+(n-1)d)\text{, where }d=6-2=4\text{ and }a=2.\\ \text{Therefore }S_{40}&=\dfrac{40}{2}(2\cdot 2 +(40-1)\cdot 4)\\ &=20(4+39\cdot4)\\ &=3200 \end{align*} $3200$ Let $2,6,10$ be the first three terms of a finite arithmetic sequence. Determine the sum of the first $40$ terms in the sequence.
